lines.text: Mrs. Saxen, we're seeking an arrest warrant for your daughter.
How could you? My daughter is only 17 years old.
OK, let's get back to Preston. So you never put Preston at risk to get drugs?
Not once? So you did drugs real civilized, right? Kind of like tea in the afternoon.
I'm trying but it's not getting better, it's getting worse.
Well, it's like The Big Book says...
We don't skip the road to happiness, we trudge.
You know the worse thing about being sober?
Yeah, your clothes reek of cigarettes all the time.
No, it's the guilt. I did so many horrible things. I messed up so many times.

I've done my share of things I'm not too proud of myself. Some I could fix. Other stuff I just kind of had to let go of. The stuff I could fix, I did. The rest of it I just had to learn to forgive myself for.
